variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: Enable or disable the module's functions.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useVar: Use Variant Encumbrance with specific type of actor
Use for example the following type of actors (e.g. character, npc, ecc. separate by character ','), remember is case sensitive
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useStr: Enable or disable the strength multiplier feature
Enable or disable the strength multiplier feature
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.streng: Work only with strength multiplier feature enabled. Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useVar: Enable automatic speed penalties from carry weight.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.unequi: Multiplier for items when not equipped.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.equipp: Multiplier for items when equipped, can be used to reduce effective weight for armour and weapons.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.profEq: Multiplier for proficient items when equipped, can be used to reduce effective weight for armour and weapons.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.curren: Define the number of coins required to equal 1 unit of weight.
Define the number of coins required to equal 1 unit of weight (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.vehicl: Vehicle weights Weight Multiplier, lbs in an imperial ton
Vehicle weights are an order of magnitude greater, Multiplier for vehicles.
Vehicle weights Weight Multiplier, kg in a metric ton (Metric System)
Vehicle weights are an order of magnitude greater, Multiplier for vehicles (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.lightM: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being encumbered from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being encumbered from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.medium: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being heavily encumbered from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being heavily encumbered from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.heavyM: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score (Metric System).
Units displayed in the encumbrance bar (just graphics).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.unitsM: Units displayed in the encumbrance bar (just graphics) (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.lightW: The number of speed units subtracted when lightly encumbered, default is 10.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.heavyW: The number of speed units subtracted when heavily encumbered, default is 20.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: I DON'T RECCOMENDED it, but does anyone seem to use this strange rule? If true the add/remove of the AE is launched only when there is a change on the value level of the tier so the refresh is ignored when add/remove/update item
Enable/Disable the feature for applying the variant encumbrance active effects for specific actor
If true add on the header sheet of the actor a button visible only to GM for enable/disable the active effects feature, by default the feature is disabled (the flag is false) for performance issues
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.remove: Remove label from buttons on the header character sheet
Remove label from buttons on the header character sheet, Useful for little screen and mobile, by default is true
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useSta: Use standard calculation weight of the dnd5e system

I DON'T RECCOMENDED it, but some people seem to lose their mind for 2s instead of 1s on the calculation weight ???, you will lose all the benefit from the others feature like Equipped, Unequipped, Proficient Equipped, Inventory +, Item container, ecc., but hey !! you got the 1 sec you miss..
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useEqu: Use equipped/unequipped feature of the ItemCollection/Item Container module for the backpack

I DON'T RECCOMENDED it, the weight calculation not 'make sense' anymore you must remember to many things, but you can now choose. Bags can be unequipped by players or GM, so that their reported weight drops to 0 in your inventory (only bags with a capacity other than 0 can be unequipped)
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.doNotU: Disable the socket call for update the encumbrance
This is ususally useful only for avoid a socket collision with other modules
This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
Prints debug messages to the console
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.dialogs.resets: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.effect.descrip: Lowers movement by 20 ft., disadvantage on all attack rolls, and disadvantage on strength, dexterity, and constitution saves
Lowers movement to 0 ft., disadvantage on all attack rolls, and disadvantage on strength, dexterity, and constitution saves
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.vehicl: Enable Unit of weight for Vehicles
Enables ability to change the base unit for weight used by vehicles
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.config.name: Weight Unit
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.config.hint: Unit of measurement to be used for weight calculation.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.label.convertC: Would you like to convert the current cargo capacity from '{{OLD}}' to '{{NEW}}'?
